video.title: Full Stack Web App using Vue.js & Express.js: Part 4
video.description:
Welcome to part 4 of a new series where I will create a full stack web application using Vue.js and Express.js

GitHub repo: https://github.com/codyseibert/tab-tracker

Follow Cody on Twitter: https://twitter.com/CodyLSeibert

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

topLevelComment.author: Olatunbosun Dare
topLevelComment.text: Incase v-layout and v-flex isn't working properly, v-layout has been replaced with v-row, and v-flex has been replaced with v-col, and you have to use cols="4" as a replacement for xs4... Loving the challenge so far...

I wonder if there will be at least an updated version of the files on github...

topLevelComment.author: Vitaliy Ostapchuk
topLevelComment.text:
Great tutorials!! Was interested in Vue, but didn't see any full-stack dev like that yet. So thanks very much for the work!

Can I ask how you actually change those many lines at once?

replies.author: dejo095
replies.text: There are plenty of ways to change multiple data in Vsc. I mostly dbl click name then press F2 to refactor, this will change name thru your project. You can alsi use ALT plus mouse click to put as many cursors as you want and just start typing... Also dbl click on name then CTRL+D will select multiple instances of your selected text

topLevelComment.author: Anu Gaavar
topLevelComment.text: some people might encounter problems with login end point, we have to delete the beforeSave hooks. that is a bug in the code

topLevelComment.author: McDonut
topLevelComment.text: Question, how do you handle files (images, pdfs, etc)? Does the file get send through axios to the backend to be stored? and then how does the client get access to the files on the server?

topLevelComment.author: Darius Goore
topLevelComment.text: really helpful series. 2 things in particular. I am familiar with RoR, so when you make comparisons to that framework/language, it is very helpful to me. eg, subcomponents remind me of partials in rails and slot tags seem very much like yield tags in rails. otoh, a service seems to be a mix between a model and controller. I imagine to the extent ou have other analogies i imagine it would help others understand as well Secondly, I very much appreciate you showing how you troubleshoot using the docs instead of pretending that everything went perfectly on the first go through!

topLevelComment.author: DJ Samke
topLevelComment.text: Hey Cody, Say you have a list of ids [1,2,3,4,5,6,8,9] and you use :key="song.id" and then later we delete id=4 and we're left with [1,2,3,5,6,7,8,9]. How will this affect the iterator? Will it know to go '3' then '5' or will it crash? Thank you!

topLevelComment.author: Alexander P
topLevelComment.text:
If you have vetur installed in vscode type `scaffold` to generate basic template
And you can iterate through object to build a form:

<v-text-field v-for="(item, key) in song"
  :key="key"
  type="text"
  :name="key"
  :label="key"
  autocomplete="off"
  clearable
  v-model="song[key]"></v-text-field>

data() {
    return {
      song: {
        title: '',
        genre: '',
        artist: '',
        album: '',
        albumImage: '',
        youtubeId: '',
        lyrics: '',
        tab: ''
      }
    };
  }

topLevelComment.author: ZhorZhan
topLevelComment.text: That thing that you don't know to much about some specifics, makes this tutorial special and easy to understand, that's because you're solving things you don't know in realtime.

topLevelComment.author: Maximilian Berkmann
topLevelComment.text:
Why don't you use v-textarea?

Also, you can simply specify to="..." in a v-btn instead of encapsulating inside a router-link.
So no need to use a navigateTo function.

A quick tip which I recently learnt: use rem to allow the user to have font size being relative to what he/she set it in his/her browser which wouldn't change the pixel unit text but would do so for those using rem/em units (for accessibility sake)

topLevelComment.text: Thank you so much for this video

topLevelComment.author: Leon Helland
topLevelComment.text: You actually could use mixins to extract some general/repetitive functions, methods, even lifecycle hooks into a mixin-file and then import it into your components.

topLevelComment.author: Tyler Williams
topLevelComment.text: You mentioned that you would like .Vue files to generate the template script style...etc tags without a copy  and paste. I am not sure if it was the vue extension in VS Code but I can type scaffold and hit enter and it adds it all for me.

replies.author: Maximilian Berkmann
replies.text:
That's because VS Code doesn't pre-fill files based on templates like WebStorm and PhpStorm does.
Plus, Cody doesn't seem to be the kind of coder who would create/use templates/snippets to type short stuff to get say a full base of a file (`<template>...</template> <script>...</script> <style scoped>...</style>`) which is doable in Sublime Text and normally also in VS Code.

topLevelComment.author: Kettle-Potato
topLevelComment.text: Hey Cody.  I am on Part 4 right now...I see you are, at this point, using SQLite...is the final version going to be deployed using a different database (e.g. MySQL or PostgreSQL)? just curious...

topLevelComment.author: Iain Diamond
topLevelComment.text:
I'm really enjoying this video series, so many thanks Cody! 

Also, I'd like to recommend using a tool like DB Browser for SQLite (http://sqlitebrowser.org). I find it useful to see what's happening inside the database as well as edit specific fields during development. This becomes especially helpful as apps grows more complex.

replies.author: Rui Ferreira
replies.text:
you can also just create routes for get methods to return the json of all the database entries.
it's not as pretty but it's still as usefull to view the data.

topLevelComment.author: Gil
topLevelComment.text: At 55:30 you can navigate with a <v-btn to="songs/add" ... >

replies.author: Ivan Miljanić
replies.text: Yes but what if you need to change all routes from project, then its easy to only change route from component in routes.js file

replies.author: Gil
replies.text:
Also at 1:00:00 instead of a your <div class="danger-alert"/> you can use the builtin alert like so => 
<v-alert
        class="ml-4"
        :value="error"
        transition="scale-transition"
        error>
        {{error}}
</v-alert>

topLevelComment.author: Gil
topLevelComment.text:
Around 30:00 the reason why your backend is crashing is because you started to define your Song's model with the attribute "albumImage" and  "youtubeId". You saved your file, the DB recorded the table as it is. Then you changed this attribute to "albumImageUrl" and "youtubeIdUrl". So now the model Song doesn't match what the engine is looking for.

A .sync({force: true}) drop the previous table and create one with the last model. :D

topLevelComment.author: Mr.Nobody
topLevelComment.text:
Hey cody i have a question i started watching your first video the intro and you said open the console but i dont know how im new to coding. and i dont know how to download anything can you plsss help me set up everything so that i can start. And also everytime i try to download something that you say this comes up npm : The term 'npm' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program. Check the spelling of the
name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.
At line:1 char:1
+ npm install -g vue-cli
+ ~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (npm:String) [], CommandNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : CommandNotFoundException.What do i do ?. Best Regards Angel :)

replies.author: Mandeep Kundal
replies.text: The 'npm' error probably shows up because it seems that you don't have Node.js installed in your pc/laptop. Open https://nodejs.org/en/ and install the latest version of node. Good luck!

topLevelComment.author: Gede Arya Indra Prabawa
topLevelComment.text: Hey cody, thank you so much for this inspiring tutor :)  can i request a video of simple full stack web apps using vanilla js ?  Cause im still a beginner and i really want to learn the fundamentals on how creating web apps. Thank you so much :))

replies.author: Gil
replies.text:
Hey Joe ! If you let me give you an advice. If you want to mastered JS a little bit more to be fully award about what you are doing that's great. I can point to you this amazing tutorial from Wes Bos : https://javascript30.com/

Then when you will want to build a real app you won't want to reinvent to wheel and become as productive as possible. So you will need to learn a framework like Angular/React/Vue.

But Cody here explain a lot of concept. But you need to have some knowledge in programming in general. Also what can be a bit  disturbing is the ES6 syntax. You can easily find nice materials on the web too.
